result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle J. Balocca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michelle J. Balocca is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michelle J. Balocca was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber for all purposes
To commence on/before

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle J. Balocca

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:01 p.m. Defendant Michelle J. Balocca in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm495 and 15ct140. Voorhees statement that defendant states citation was delivered to home and not received by her until today. Michlig/Voorhees statement to immediate remand to jail in case 15CF166. Michlig/Voorhees statement to bail - Court sets $ sig  bond on each case. Court statement on remand. Court vacates stay of jail sentence in 15cf166 and orders immediate remand. Defendant requests time to report - Court denies request. Adj. 2:11 p.m.

3:20 p.m. Defendant Michelle J. Balocca in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf166 and 15cf196. State moves to amend Count 2 in 15cf166 to misdemeanor battery - Class A Misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 1 in 15cf166 and 15cf196 - Granted. Plea questionaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Cirilli/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
CC/DNA Surcharge
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 30 days with Huber for all purposes to commence on/before Saturrday January 2, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Jail credit - 1 day
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 3:39 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

9:33 a.m. Defendant Michelle J. McCourtney in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf166 and 15cf196.  Defendant's name should be reflected as Balocca.  Case caption in 15cf166 should be changed to reflect State of Wisconsin v. Michelle J. Balocca. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Informations have been filed in each case. Cirilli-in receipt of Informations and waive further reading - Not guilty pleas entered - Bail continued. Adj. 9:38 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Per Terry at Attorney Cirilli's office - take off 9/11/15 hearing from calendar - will contact JA to reschedule
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

2:54 p.m. Defendant Michelle J. McCourtney in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued
Adj. 2:55 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
No contact with Kathleen L. Blakely-Beukema. No intoxicants, no taverns.

1:19 pm Defendant Michelle J. McCourtney in court via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $  sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
